website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best value on the market. These gloves offer fit, durability, and function at a relatively low price.
pros: Unique patented design improves grip and wrist strength
cons: The design is not for everyone, but for the price and quality, they are worth trying

customer_reviews.title: Cobra grips have served me very well. For the ...
customer_reviews.text: Cobra grips have served me very well. For the price, they can't be beaten. See attached video for my thoughts on Cobra grips vs Versa grips!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept, poor QC / Materials
customer_reviews.text: I was eager to try these given all of the reviews, but i was unpleasantly surprised once i slipped them on. The fit and finish of my unit was horrible! the seams were unfinished, the strap ends tore my wrist up. I slipped on them a few times and it looks like i was mauled by a kitten. The rubber flap did have a good texture and provided enough grip but once tight the strap felt like 60 grit sandpaper, very unpleasant experience. Perhaps it's just the fit and finish of the unit i received.
customer_reviews.author: Riktar

customer_reviews.title: Need grip help on lightweight pulls? Sure! Need functional grip help on heavy lifts? Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I don't want to use chalk in the gym. My straps slip and my grip strength isn't strong enough to keep adding plates to the bar. I figured this might help me out. It did not. If you have the slightest bit of condensation on your hands these will slip. I attempted to use them on the first set of my 5x5 @ 475 deads. I couldn't even get through the first two reps. Went back to straps.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Epps

customer_reviews.title: Incredible straps for the first eight months
customer_reviews.text: The straps worked in credible the first 8 months. Soon after that I began to notice fraying along the strap which I believe is due to the fact the metal friction against the strap ( could be resolved by smoothing out metal bit more) 2nd The plastic on the strap began to tear/ deteriorate as well. Seen in photo pen goes right through the strap itself .
customer_reviews.author: D&G

customer_reviews.title: Game Changing Lifting Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These lifting gloves are a game charger. I'm decently strong but have always had issues with my wrists and hands. No matter how much I lift, my grip just doesn't seem to be on par, well at least not when it comes to dead-lifts. Perfectly compensate for the lack of grip and truly allow my whole body to work. Sucks when your hands are done but you know you haven't pushed yourself to the point of growth change. These gloves allow that and can't wait to see the progress over the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: Photos-NXS

customer_reviews.title: After using Versa Grips for over 15years, I switched
customer_reviews.text: Versa Grips have been my go to for over 15 years. They reliably last 4-6 years, and it was time to order a new pair of pro's. After seeing the reviews (and price difference), I decided to give these Cobra Grips a try. As you can see by the picture, there is more padding, which makes heavy deadlifts more comfortable. The padding also provides greater wrist support on pressing movements. The Rubber Grip Cobra piece also covers more surface area and secured the grips better than the versa on heavy pulling movements. Assuming they hold up as long, I find the Cobra Grips superior to the Versa Grips in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Disciple of Hugeness

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a female who is not strong at all. However, I have wrist problems and don't want to injury my wrist when I lift. I use them for small weights. They work just as well. The lip may get in the way a little bit if you're just lifting a couple of dumbbells. However, it's easy to get around the lip. They're very comfortable. A man in the gym even asked me where I bought them. At first, I felt a little embarrassed to be using them for such small weights. However, if I can pay a reasonable amount of money to avoid injury and possibly very high doctor bills, then it's totally worthwhile. Everyone has his/her own starting point.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Best Gloves I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: these are the best gloves i've ever had. i absolutely love them. i can lift heavy now with no problem. Before these gloves my grip wasn't as strong as I needed it to be to do deadlifts, now it's no problem. I can keep adding weight and i haven't had to stop. My grip doesn't fail anymore. I tried the metal hook gloves for pulling or deadlift exercises and I couldn't use them because they strained my palms. These are nothing like that. In fact, these replace the padded weight lifting gloves and I can use these for all of the weight exercises everyday. Great product. I am female, with small hands and these work just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: sunny74

customer_reviews.title: These really work!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my back and deadlift workouts. They perform 100% and I highly recommend these lifting gloves. The grip is amazing and your wrists don't get pulled out of shape. The padding is enough but not too much around your wrist. The grips have left/right written on them for your hand placement. The only thing I don't like is the metal strap ring should be on other side of strap because it sometimes digs into my wrist, so what I do is use left grip on right hand and right grip on left hand and problem is solved for me.
customer_reviews.author: Suni

customer_reviews.title: These are great for saving your hands and letting you focus on your lift
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of Cobra Grips and I like the rubber ones even more than the leather. The leather ones I had were solid for 3 years but the kurling on the bars rubbed them smooth so they lost much of their gripping power even though they were comfy. Enter the new rubber ones and they are very nice. They hold much more securely in my hand and are easy to put on and off, twist around, whatever. Grip training is important but when I'm working multi-rep deadlifts, I want to focus on my form and cues, not having my mind preoccupied with thinking about whether my grip will give out.
customer_reviews.author: James Six

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed...grip substance on hand grip worn off. Do not use these glove anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my grip kept slipping when doing heavy deadlifts. I tried straps, but even those didn't help much. I saw someone recommend these on a fitness forum, and I thought I'd give them a try. They really work!! I keep my grip firmly and comfortably with these on. I've used them with a barbell for deadlifts (and I was able to up my weight by an additional 15 pounds immediately) and I've also used them with really heavy kettlebells for lunges. I have never lost my grip with these on- they really work exceptionally well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sasny

customer_reviews.title: Pads move a little but really awesome
customer_reviews.text: I like them very much, the only downside of them is that when you turn either around your wrists (for example to type on your phone) the pads get misplaced and twist in the inner part.. it’s easy to bring back to the right position but it would be great if they would just stay in place. Aside from that, they’re awesome and very flexible, not like others (versa grips for instance) that you have to break in with time to get that bending going smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Liana

customer_reviews.title: so I'm not tiny (nor am I huge) and to get a good tight support on my wrist
customer_reviews.text: I wish they offered a little variance in size as the wrist wraps are a little too big for my wrists. I'm 6'1 190lbs, so I'm not tiny (nor am I huge) and to get a good tight support on my wrist, I end up with about an inch and a half of strap hanging. Not to mention that to even get them so the padding area doesn't roll up from having to pull them tighter, I have to maneuver them around my wrist. Product works as it should, just wish the wrist support was a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Cack

customer_reviews.title: Work well.
customer_reviews.text: First time using grips to assist. I used for knee to chest movements while hanging from bar, and for normal grip deadlift (270) product works as advertised and holds well. Maybe all grips have the same issue I felt... like my hands had been a little hyper extended from my wrists. I let the weight rest on the grips, this transfers it to my wrists instead of my fingers/grip. It did help a lot. But, I think I will stick to alternating grip without wraps. I realize that getting to heavier weight may require grips and some discomfort though, and if that is the case - I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Get it. You'll lift heavier. Grip no longer an issue.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, day one using these I lifted heavier, left them on during the whole workout, nice wrist support too. My lat pulldown, cable row, deadlift, all improved day one. Normally my grip and forearms give out even though I could do more, with these my whole workout was actually fun, focused on just pulling, not losing my grip. These are really easy to grip, unlike the power straps which takes time to get ready. When these break I'll just buy another, I don't see why you would buy the versa grips for double the price... I bought the pro rubber ones which feel really grippy, not sure if the leather would be any better.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. This is similar to the Versa gripp, but better. I personally think this is more comfortable compared to the Versa gripp. Keep in mind when ordering that you purchase the right one. I purchased the women's version by accident, because there is both a women's and men's version. The women's version can handle a 4.5"-6.25" wrist. I have an 8" wrist and there is still plenty of room incase yours are larger. If you are in the market for grips like this look no further. These are well worth the money. I also plan on doing a more in-depth video review, so please check it out.
customer_reviews.author: Mikenedge

customer_reviews.title: 100% Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: This is the single best piece of gym equipment I have ever purchased! It takes away all of the strain and pain in my fingers and improves my grip 100%, which allows me to lift much heavier weight than I normally would. I haven’t lifted heavy weights in over 4 months due to the pain in my hands/fingers, so I got online and started searching for a solution and then I came across the Cobra Grips Weight Lifting Gloves. I’d recommend them to anyone who has issues with grip or pain in their fingers and/or hands. I’m finally lifting weights again and am 100% satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: First impression: great looking product. They also are super functional. I really do like these after a few workouts. I have used my friends Versa Grips before but these are much better. Downsides: (1)After 2 workouts the Cobra graphic is almost gone from the rubber pad. (2) when you get weight on the wraps the thick foam around the wrists compresses and they have a tendency to feel a little loose, so you need to make sure they are extra tight before the set. Overall though they are a great gym product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for preventing tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: Leg Day! If you get to the point where your grip strength won't allow you to hold the weights, buy these. They are worth every penny! I have had trouble with de Quervain'stendonitis in my thumbs since I was pregnant with my first born. I normally maxed out at 15 lbs without making it flare up. I bought these while doing ChaLean Extreme and fell in love. I used 27.5s and 37.5s for all three rounds of 80 Day Obsession today! I am not affiliated with this company in any way. I'm just a very satisfied customer! They have models for woman and men now. I've got the men's cause the women's didn't exist when I bought mine.
customer_reviews.author: Love those kids

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Tears Clothing
customer_reviews.text: I would give the grips 5-stars except for the Velcro strip design being backwards: the Velcro hook strip is across the wrist and the velcro loop strip is on the strap. The strap isn't long enough to cover the entire wrist so a lot of the hooks are left exposed to catch on clothing. It has very strong hooks (good) but it's caused holes in my thin Under Armour work out tank top, which I keep wearing because I don't want holes in another top. It also catches on my shorts and damages them. Putting the Velcro hook strip on the strap and the soft loop strip on the wrist would solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: C. O.

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars- warning for people with sweaty hands
customer_reviews.text: I'm comparing these to simple tried-and-true lifting straps. When your hands are dry, Cobra Grips are 5 stars, they give you wrist protection and there is no set up time at the bar because you don't have to worry about wrapping straps around the bar. However, I gave this 4 stars because while I deadlift I sweat a lot, and the Cobra Grips slip in my hands some when I have sweaty hands. This is fixed by just using a little bit of chalk, but in the perfect world, the cobra grips would work even if i was sweaty, because normal straps work no matter how sweaty you are.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Walton

customer_reviews.title: Going to Last a Long Time
customer_reviews.text: These are not your local sporting goods store Grip/Lifting Straps and though I have only had them a short time there is not a doubt that these will endure anything I'm going to do with them for a very long time. The leather version is slightly stiff at first but that is logical and quickly changes like any quality leather item. Be sure to wear them as recommended in the insert that comes with. These are worth the price is you are looking for a serious piece of equipment, and I do mean equipment. Buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil H.

customer_reviews.title: Less would be more with this product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Cobra Grips Pro. They are phenomenal and work as advertised, but I have one issue. I was considering returning them, but instead I cut off the unnecessarily large "Grip Power Pads" That catch on all sorts of things. I don't even understand the purpose of them, unless it is to get caught on things and make the velcro strap wear faster. If it were just a velcro strap, I would recommend these to others, but I feel it is a big design flaw in an otherwise very good product. (My grips are 4 stars now that I cut off the rubber pads).
customer_reviews.author: Ray B

customer_reviews.title: Grips - comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used for first time doing 3 sets of 8 deadlifts. I found the grips to be comfortable, easy to grip, and durable (more time will tell on this one). I think I will like these better than my straps. I have a hard time using the straps for anything more than deadlift. I find theses are easier to use on pull-ups, chins, etc. Last, if your gym does not allow chalk, you won’t need it using these grips. My home gym will stay a little cleaner as a result. Overall, I am impressed and pleased with this product. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: D Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Still looking around. Use chalk powder with these.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Schiek Model 1900 Ultimate Grips, which lasted only a year. Decided to try this strap only to find minor inconveniences that I did not have before. When my palm sweats, these grips were harder to maintain a solid hold. In addition, the sweat just accumulates around my wrist wrap due to its bulkiness and wrap around coverage. I specifically choose the rubber version to avoid these issues, but maybe it just need some adjustment. I will be purchasing chalk powder in addition to this.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Quite Impressed at the Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are FAR easier and quicker to set up on the bar than regular straps, and they are very comfortable. I've not experienced any issue with pressure points in the wrist. The leather flaps with their lip on the end, I would go so far as to say, are probably more secure than straps which have to wrap around the bar a couple times. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Berry

customer_reviews.title: They did take a little getting used to but once you figure them out your good to go
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of some new grips and upon looking at and researching other grips I decided to try give Cobra Grips a try. They did take a little getting used to but once you figure them out your good to go. I mainly use these for deadlifts they help me grip anything over 315lbs now. I feel comfortable knowing that my grip is not going to give out in the middle of a rep. I’m now able to add more weight and more reps. I give these grips a 5 star rating due to the fact that they are easy to use and above all they work.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy T.

customer_reviews.title: A great product to protect your elbow joints
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a heavy weight dead lifter, but at age 65 I still lift and have suffered with elbow tendinitis causing inflamed forearm flexors and a weaker grip resulting in lifting less weight. I tried straps, but miss the use of my gloves. Bought these from the reviews and am very pleased. I use these primarily for seated rows and lat pull downs, but I have found they replace my gloves for pushing exercises so I just keep them on. The relief from elbow pain is noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: gapwedge

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the straps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I've tried the longer straps, and hate spending time wrapping them around the bar. These wrap around easily and quickly. The material on the wrist guards is comfortable and the velcro straps are high quality. The rubber material does make your hands smell a little bit, but it doesn't bother me. The cobra graphic does wear off pretty quickly (withing 5-10 lifts), but I thought it looked silly anyway. Suggest manufacturer just remove it on next models. I predominantly use on back days for deadlift. They also help in rows and pulldowns. Anything where I want to minimize pulling with my forearms and focus on my back. These work great! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brett W

customer_reviews.title: Cobra grips!
customer_reviews.text: I used them wrong at first but then looked into it more and needed to wrap them a different way when doing combo lifts. I’ve had a little bit of a weak grip and these really help keep control and my forearms still feels sore and are gaining strength! I like that there were so many colors to choose from and sizes for men and women. They have left and right grips that help with positioning. This is my first pair that I’ve ever bought but I really love the quality and price, they have held up for the past 6 months!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really helps my grip
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried them a few times side receiving them. I struggle with my grip especially doing deadlifts. I used them for deadlifts and they greatly helped my grip. I'll continue to use them. They seem pretty sturdy and if good quality. I bought the rubber ones and I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Love the look of these 😍
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the leather on these lifting gloves. The only thing that I noticed was that I wasn’t able to grip the bar for deadlifts very securely. That could mean I may need more practice or I may need to break them in a bit. I do like the wrist support that they provide. They are good gloves, well made and look really cool!
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Annoying, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm sold--these things are Awesome! They're a pain to put on, and I can't synch my lifting belt easily (or do much of anything really) once I've got them on, BUT--I've been able to massively increase my deadlifts with these. No more wrist/hands giving out! I was amazed by how much more weight I could lift with these on b/c of how safe my hands felt. I lift recreationally, (I'm a 5' 1" female and ordered the Fit size), so I'm not worried about forearms, etc, but I went up 15lbs in Sumos and RDLs (5x5s) with these suckers on. They're annoying, sure, but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST the best lifting straps
customer_reviews.text: The Cobra lifting straps are built like a beast. Very thick leather, stitching is solid and the wrist wrapping part is secure, comfortable (way more comfortable than many others) and rigid enough for support, but not so much that they did into your wrists. The only issue I have found is they need to be about 1/2-1" longer in the bar wrap "cobra" head. They don't completely wrap around the bar, which makes lifting very heavy weights a little tricky. It's even worse on thick or padded bars. I would still purchase them again and highly recommend them, but just note that one deficit in design.
customer_reviews.author: Dirigible

customer_reviews.title: Way better than straps
customer_reviews.text: By far superior to regular straps. With straps I was getting nerve damage around my thumb are due to the old straps overnightening around my wrists and hands. I was getting numbness and tingling in those areas -- definitely not good at all! Now with these cobra grips all that damage and concern is gone! Not only that, I can lift a bit more with less strain. Buy them now if you're considering these as a replacement for regular straps. I wish I would have known about these sooner. They're amazing.
customer_reviews.author: rickyrich

customer_reviews.title: Review of Rubber Cobra Grips
customer_reviews.text: We accidentally purchased the rubber grips instead of the leather ones for my husband. We were going to send them back but I decided to use them instead (home gym with cold bars). They are much more comfortable than standard wraps for deadlifting and easier to use. We wouldn't suggest the rubber for heavy lifts (over 300 lbs probably), but in the lower weights they are good. If you are power lifting over 300, get the leather ones.
customer_reviews.author: kim-in-bloom

customer_reviews.title: Like Cobras better than Versa Gripps so far
customer_reviews.text: I've used Versa Gripps over the years and went though several pairs. Versa's rubber grips tore quicker than I expected, so I had to buy new ones a couple of times. This time around I decided to give Cobras a try. I have the same reservations about rubber grips so I went with leather. So far so good, I really like them. I was worried that leather wouldn't be as grippy but it's been great! The leather "tongue" definitely feels better and more pliable than rubber. One other thing I like about Cobras is that they come in one size, as opposed to Versas that you had to measure and get your sizing right. We'll see how durable Cobras are.
customer_reviews.author: Long Islander

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I felt like the hook grip was damaging my thumb and I didn't want to go with a mixed grip and risk developing imbalances, so I looked into straps. I can't speak to their competitors, but the Cobras feel great, at a great price point. I only use them for my "working" deadlift sets and for barbell rows, given their build quality I would anticipate them holding up for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ever investment for those in to weight training
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Grip is like magic, never felt this kind of control with wrist straps. I could lift 50 pounds more instantly - like I said, it is magic!! Fingers are never in play - weight is directly distributed to the wrist. Cons: Gets in way when you use towel, cellphones, etc. I don't think I can use this for push workouts. Bottomline: This is a must have for your "pull" workouts. For push workouts, switch to regular workout gloves.
customer_reviews.author: GalaxyYellow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different grips over many, many years of bodybuilding and weight lifting in general. These are the best grips I have come across. the design and workmanship are exceptional, durable and very heavy duty. They are comfortable and I couldn't be more pleased with them. I also purchased the hooks, which are equally impressive! These guys know what they're doing! Very pleased with both of my purchases! Steve Kaeser
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST WEIGHT LIFTING GLOVES EVER
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid gym rat and do a lot of heavy lifting. I used basic lifting gloves for years and within the last year started lifting heavy and went to strap lifting gloves. I recently discovered Cobra Grips and so glad I did. It's a challenge to find fashionable, yet functional heavy lifting gloves for women. I've used another company who is very expensive, and my gripps are already falling apart. I ordered these for my boyfriend and was very impressed with the quality and the look of these. I can't wait to get my clients hooked on these.
customer_reviews.author: AP_in_AZ

customer_reviews.title: Better than others
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a gift. I severely injured my wrist a few years ago and my grip suffers. Also, if anything pulls on my wrist a certain way it is very painful. I have used another more expensive brand for a while but these distribute the weight much better. I've had others for several years and the cobra pros are obviously made better so I believe they'll hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mayton

customer_reviews.title: Must have for pull days!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They come in handy on several key pull exercises that I am now able to go way higher and isolate the muscles much better. My Barbell rows, shrugs, and pull-ups have all gotten significantly better because grip was often a limiting factor. Not to be used all the time because grip strength is important, but these just allow you to isolate better for heavy days.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Parkent

customer_reviews.title: Work our hard these glove can handle it!
customer_reviews.text: These are truly great gloves and do exactly what they say, I work out 7 days a week and put them to work everyday , the only thing that suck is the cobra head wears off (which I know is normal) but when you first get that looks bad ass , but these are way Better then that plastic junk I have broken in less then a couple weeks deadlifting, these also take the strain off areas during any pull type lifting
customer_reviews.author: Ed Moffett

customer_reviews.title: Good for small wrists
customer_reviews.text: I’m a small female. 5’0 120ish lbs. Meaning I have small wrists. These work perfect! I was using regular straps but these really helped me lift heavier. Rack pulls and deadlifts are so much easier now! I did compare them with another girl’s grips that are not the Conra ones and hers were thinner and narrower but no complaints here. They are thick but I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Gregory

customer_reviews.title: A great unexpected gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my brother and he loves them. He previously used Versa Gripps and couldn't imagine using anything else. After reading the reviews for this product, I thought I'd take a chance and I'm glad I did. The material is of good quality. There are numerous benefits of using them in several exercises to make progress. My brother's at the gym 5-6 days a week and follows intense workout programs. He's thanked me multiple times for them. Definitely consider these as a gift or for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Sangie

customer_reviews.title: An absolute must for light or heavy lifting.
customer_reviews.text: Great construction. I bought the brown leather. The combination of the wrist wrap and the grip pad has helped me lift heavier and comfortably without any major strain on my wrists. My last heavy sets have been all concentration without wondering if my hands will give before the body part I'm working on. When I kill this one, which I'm sure it will take a long time, I will immediately purchase another. First workout was strange having never used this type of grip, now it's second nature and I use it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: USMCDINO

customer_reviews.title: The people who created the Cobra Grips understood our dilemma and developed a product that is so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to find some hard core lifting straps, but the problem with most of them is that it is hard and time consuming to wrap the straps around your wrists. The people who created the Cobra Grips understood our dilemma and developed a product that is so easy to use; no more fumbling and stumbling, trying to wraps those long wraps around your wrists, the Cobra grips has no straps, it has leather pads that you place on your palms, then you grab the bar or dumbbells and get to work, it only takes you about five seconds to get ready. For about half the price of the overly priced competition, you really get your money's worth 💰😺
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Pelaez

customer_reviews.title: Get a pair!!
customer_reviews.text: The one pair of grips/wraps/straps for all my lifting & calisthenic needs. Losses 1 star for durability as there is a bit of fraying after a year of use. Losses 2 stars for comfor: superbly comfortable, but sometimes the wrist support will fold in on itself when tightening and pinch the skin. It can be difficult to put them on correctly. Improvement idea #1: Cut off excess wrist support that tends to fold over. Improvement idea #2: Write "LEFT" & "RIGHT" on another part of the strap. When the strap is loosened so that you can pass your hand through, the current text doesn't show.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Harper

customer_reviews.title: Great product, recommend these grips
customer_reviews.text: Overall I give them a 5. I only half ave 4 rating for durability and stability because I haven’t had them long enough to for a solid opinion. I deadlift 465 with know problems with grip. It was a little awkward but I believe it’s just because I’m Iliad to straps. I had no problem with the actual grip so I believe it was just a mental distraction. I have used these for bent over rows and tbar, loved the performance Did take me a little bit to get use to single handed gripping these but no problem at all. I also bout a ladies fit for my wife, she loves them as well. Great product and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cobra Grips PRO are great
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Absolutely love them. Initially I bought a competitors version, but ended up returning them because they didn't feel good when using them. I tried Cobra next, which I loved for 2 main reasons. The first, there is a small piece of cushion that flares up and faces your wrist. I feel like this protects and cushions the wrist when you strap these tight. The other ones didn't have it and it ended up pinching my wrists. The second reason is that the strap flares wide at the top. This gives me more surface to wrap against the bar. The competitors didn't do this, and it wasn't as easy/comfortable when using.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Noble

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job, Great Quality; sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: They are little bulky, but they do the job. The straps and quality of them are very sturdy. Reminds me of my weight lifting belt. Very strong. The leather padding on the palms are great. Provide comfort, prevent the skin cracking, and having a better grip means a better rep, set, and workout. I been exercising for the past 7 years now. I've had every kind of wrist strap support for lifting. These and the basic straps have worked best for me. But I wanted something with more wrist support since I lift heavier than I did earlier when I started.
customer_reviews.author: im

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, trust their size recommendations.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well made / sturdy. Works better than standard lifting straps in my opinion. Great for deadlifts/rows/pull-ups when your trying to isolate back and not worry about your grip failing you first. I got the black leather fit model even though it said for women and it is tight on my wrists so if you were curious about that I'd say definitely go for the pro model if you have man sized wrists, but this pair fits my girlfriend perfectly so she is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Swanner

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really was hoping that the cost of these would yield proper value, but they simply do not. These didn't even hold up more than 2 months before one hand started to tear in the middle area. The company will only honor a return if I mail it to them, not even worth the hassle for a product that's just going to break again. I'd be better off investing in the cheaper ones and using them until they break. If you're lifting heavy or high volume, these simply wont last.
customer_reviews.author: derrick wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as they seem
customer_reviews.text: I'll go against the hype and say these things arent that great I wouldn't use them for wrist support because when doing any pushing movements your wrist is still able to bend backwards as far as dead lift it's fine if your not sweating and using light weight but as for myself I sweat and I lift a lot and these thing would slip like crazy the rubber and sweaty hands don't mix it's like having bad tires on a wet road. I would say if your a beginner and dont plan on lifting seriously go for it but they are not for me the straps worked better in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ofc yougood

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by how well these work.
customer_reviews.text: I have tennis elbow in both elbows, and have been struggling with grip and back exercises (barbell rows, lat pulldowns, etc.). My Back was much stronger, and able to move more weight than I could keep a good grip on. I got on amazon to get some hooks, and came across these. I thought I would give them a try, and I'm glad I did. I was able to increase the weight I was working with, without any grip issues. I was surprised by the nice side effect of less elbow pain during and post workouts too. If you're on the fence give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cobra Grips Pro are great
customer_reviews.text: My hands have been getting pretty beat up and calloused with traditional straps. My friend uses Versa Pros and let me try those out and I really liked them. I saw these Cobras on amazon for much less than the Versa product and am really happy with the purchase. They are very heavy duty. The palm flap is rubber vs the leather on the versa product but look and feel very sturdy. Even without break-in the flap wrapped easily around bars and dumbells. The added padding was much more comfortable than traditional straps and just as sturdy and quicker to set up each set. Grab a pair, these things are great.
customer_reviews.author: jehlikejam

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Got the leather ones. Very durable, fits well, and really helps a lot for deadlifts when normally your grip would tire out. It's much faster to implement then straps. The only knock I would say is it is a bit expensive for what it is, but the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: bjjanesth

customer_reviews.title: Wow.... just buy em
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced lifter and athlete. I have used straps, hooks, you name it, over the past 25 years. These are with out a doubt made for serious lifting with “durable” comfort. Perfect for pulling/back exercises where you need overload passed your grip strength. Finally you can concentrate on on the muscle being used, and not your grip.
customer_reviews.author: CaliConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite gym accessory!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these under another vendor thinking they were another type of VersaGrips. The pair that arrived were metal hooks instead of a flexible material! Not at all what I was looking for. I found these and after reading reviews found that these were basically a cheaper version of the Versa. They are exactly what i needed. Not too bulky in the wrist (the metal hooks were very stiff and bulky), flexible enough for pressing and pulling and seem very durable! Would recommend this to anyone looking for an alternative to Versa.
customer_reviews.author: T. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: I really like these grips.
customer_reviews.text: I got the 175 lb dumbbells from powerblock, and they have much larger grips than the standard dumbbells. This comes into play as I don't have the largest hands, but they are strong and thick from my strongman background. Sometimes I just need to focus on getting the weight between A to B, and not have to worry about my grip giving out. Hope to see how these hold up in the long term, but so far they have been very good. My main issue is that my palms get sweaty, and that makes grip a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Cobra Grips are amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am old school and have only had experience with straps but these Cobra grips are amazing! I cant believe how much better these are than straps. There so easy to use. My back used to suffer because my grip would fail before my back, even with straps. Now I put on the Cobra grips and i can go as hard as my back can handle. No problem. I definitely recommend these. Like Tony the Tiger they're grrrrrreat!
customer_reviews.author: john seeley

customer_reviews.title: Changed my lifting game
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing. I have experimented with a million different ways to handle the grip problem during deadlifts, and while many of them have been doable, they weren't ideal. These Cobra Grips changed the game for me. The grip is solid, the straps don't get too tight, and they are built extremely well. Highly recommend these things for anyone that doesn't care for the mixed grip, hook grip, or standard straps. Love these things.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If confidence is what you lack, try these grippers
customer_reviews.text: I turned 50yrs this past March. I went many years slacking on exercise. I noticed my grip failing slightly, during dumbbell workouts. That to be expected however, I have the Cobra Grip Pro gloves. To be completely honest people... These glove give confidence in my grip. I'm not selling a thing. You try them and believe for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for Powerblocks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help shrug heavy weight and they are very, very good with bars and most dumbells. The review that stated they dig into the wrists is completely unfounded. They have a ton of comfy padding and I can't make them hurt my wrists even by deliberately over-tightening them. No exposed metal whatsoever. Unfortunately they are just too big to stuff into Powerblocks and grip. This would not be an issue of the grippy tube was removable from the pad from the side. But they still get a four-star rating because I don't think any presently competing product would fare much better. For Powerblocks, use chalk. For everything else, these are really good.
customer_reviews.author: Triplebreak

customer_reviews.title: Quality Build, Great Design. - Update - STILL GREAT - 2 Year Update - BUY NOW.
customer_reviews.text: ***2 YEAR UPDATE*** Still working like new. Better than the other, more popular brand. Do not hesitate to buy. ***UPDATE*** Still going strong. Used 4-5 times a week. No issues. I just got these Saturday and have used them twice. They are SO much better than the VersaGrips I have used over the last 3 years or so (to be fair, they are pretty beat up at this point). The shape and size of the grip makes it easy to wrap for pulling and pushing quickly. The VersaGrip design takes much longer due to the design length. I am sure there +/- to both, but I immediately felt comfortable using this item. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Hidden

customer_reviews.title: Instant increase in lift weight.
customer_reviews.text: These instantly boosted my deadlift 20 lbs, zero additional training. 305 struggling to an instant 325. Easy to use - thought there might be a learning curve with adjustments, figuring out how to grip etc. - there was nothing. Put them on, ready to rumble. Love love love that I can drop the bar with these. No shredded palms, no blood, my hands were good to go afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenA

customer_reviews.title: Not quite Versa grips
customer_reviews.text: I got these as an alternative to my Versa-Grip Pros. These appear to be well made, heavy duty, pretty comfortable. My only real issue with them is they are too bulky for me. Not a deal breaker, but just not as nice as the Versa Grips in that department. I have to fiddle with these a little more to get my grip. Overall pretty nice
customer_reviews.author: Spoony920

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and then some !
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Cobra Grips and not because of wear and tear. Only because I wanted another color. I DO NOT leave my house without either pair. They are great for protecting your hands agains calluses but also very helpful on heavier lifts. Super easy to get on and off, lightweight and durable. Nothing but love for Cobra Grips.
customer_reviews.author: Antionette Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Greatest workout grip out there!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit! Very sturdy and well built! Works better than any strap out there! I use straps because of my right “pinky” finger injury which stops me from grasping difficult even with the use of regular lifting straps. The metal hook grips are too bulky and uncomfortable for me but these grips are the best! Pricey but will worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: SSgt B

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work.. Would be nice if longer version for those with bigger hands.
customer_reviews.text: I found that it works pretty well for me but I have very large hands. Would be nice if they were about an inch longer since my hands are 8" long from the wrist to the end of my fingers. I find some issues at times when using in place of gloves for grasping but work well for dead lifts and such where pulling a lot of weight. Again would be nice if they were about an inch longer though.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my fist pair of this style of lifting straps; I’ve used the traditional straps for years but due to do the wrist pressure with old school straps I thought I would give these a shot. Cobra straps are VERY well made and will likely have them for years. They do increase the diameter of your grip so take some time to get used to. The pads also seem rotate outward with use but easy to readjust. I still use my traditional straps for some workouts but these are a great tool to use!!
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Super tough and secure grip enhancers / wrist supports.
customer_reviews.text: Good for heavy pulls (deadlifts and power shrugs is what i use them for ). I have not used them for bench press or overhead presses yet. They really do feel comfortable with heavy loads but when you start to sweat quite a bit , they do get a little bit slick (nothing a little chalk won't fix though). Very nice and versatile gear to have for the gym. You won't be disappointed in having them. Many more uses than what I use them for. BTW , have some chalk or some way to keep hands dry when pulling above 550 lbs and you will be fine. Very secure grip with extremely fast and easy bail out capability.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away!
customer_reviews.text: I had never used any types of lifting straps or supports, I believe in building the strength of my wrists. That being said, some lifts feel like they're about to rip my hand off of my wrist! haha. These are VERY simple and they eliminate the strain on my wrists. One-arm bent over row with 120 pound dumbbell, didn't feel a thing. I was blown away with how well they work and if they don't break down super fast I will definitely be a repeat buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Can’t return?
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept and agree that this is a better solution than bulky and sweaty gloves. My problem is that as smaller frame man, I purchased the pro version which is too large. Unfortunately, this Amazon merchant does not allow returns which is rare by Amazon standards.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny P

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best grip bands in the market!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried about four different products, some in combination with chalk... until I found the Cobra grip bands. I absolutely love them! I have tiny wrists, but very bony so the men model worked best for me. Also, I prefer leather over rubber but I'm sure the rubber option would be just as good. I use them to comfortably deadlift 180 lb, and still going up on weight. I absolutely recommend this product. You won't find anything better!
customer_reviews.author: Lillian M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than versa gripps and $20 cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and comfortable padding. I have both versa gripps pro and cobra grips pro. In my honest opinion, I like the cobra grips a lot more. Better comfort, solid quality, and great price point ( $20 cheaper than versa gripps ). I was hesitant to buy these since I own a pair of versa gripps, but cobra grips definitely surprised me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Khu

customer_reviews.title: Not like Versas
customer_reviews.text: My husband recently lost his pair of Versas at the gym due to someone's sticky fingers so I decided to get him some more grips. I let him pick out what grips he wanted and he decided to go with the rubber ones, thinking that they would have a similar texture as the Versas with a better price point. Nope, not at all. The grip is longer and the texture is smother so the grips don't hold the bar as well as we had hoped. They have good padding around the wrist area and these might work best for larger hands/ thicker bars. Ultimately, they don't compare to Versas. :(
customer_reviews.author: Laura T

customer_reviews.title: Great straps and great quality to boot
customer_reviews.text: Love these straps! Always stole my boyfriends, so I finally got my own. I see the difference between the fit and the pro. The fit are definitely meant for smaller wrists. I'm waiting for mine to get a little less stiff but that doesn't kill it's use. These bad boys are my go to for deadlifts and anything dumbell related. Great quality and fast shipping. Definitely going to purchase from them if I need anything else.
customer_reviews.author: rosacandoodle

customer_reviews.title: Cobra Grips Pro are the grips you want; don't waste your money on the "other"grips !!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW !!! I wish I had ordered these years ago. I admit I had a pair of the "other" Grips until I lost one at the gym. I purchased these Cobra Grips Pro simply because they were cheaper with a good review. Well I received them today and used them today working back in the gym. AWESOME grips. I like them better all around compared to the "other" pair. Style cut, fit & feel are all better. These are the grips you want; don't waste your money on the "other" grips !!! Gerald G in TN
customer_reviews.author: Double-G in TN

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STRAPS for submaximal training, but NOT great for getting every ounce you can out of your 1RM
customer_reviews.text: These lifting straps are fantastic for rowing exercises, deadlifts, and anything else requiring you to pull weight. However, these are not the best strap option out there for going for a 1 rep max. I don't feel as tight with these are I do with regular lifting straps. I actually missed a 635 pull while wearing these, took them off and put on regular 10 dollar straps, and got the lift easily. I personally just don't feel close enough to the bar with these like I do with regular straps. That being said, these are a fantastic product. They are great for training pulling exercises and are easier on the hands than regular straps. Great for training, not for competition.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G Anderson Jr

customer_reviews.title: These Grips are the real deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife, I have the Pro. These Cobra Grips work great. Easy to wrap around the bar and the wrist support is better than wrist wraps. My wife and I have been using our Cobra Grips for a few weeks and these are hands down the best grips ever. I like how they wrap around the bar for Dead-lifts, Bent over rows, RDLs etc. The company is first rate, they back there product and have videos on how the care and use of the grips.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lind

customer_reviews.title: The best piece of exercise equipment for lifting weights!
customer_reviews.text: I got these Cobra Grips a few days ago and so far I am loving them. Great padding on the wrist and awesome tight grip, I won’t lift without them from now on. Before when I lifted with the hooks and straps they put a lot of strain on my forearms and hands but these Cobra Grips took a lot of the strain away so I can lift longer. Quick grip and easy release. I wish I bought them ages ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: tri tran

customer_reviews.title: these seem to work better. The Leather isnt as stiff and is easier ...
customer_reviews.text: I have previously used Versa Grips, these seem to work better. The Leather isnt as stiff and is easier to wrap around the bar for grip.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy C.

customer_reviews.title: Better grip=heavier weight
customer_reviews.text: They work well for dead lifts & pull ups and allow for heavy sets without having to worry about grip.
customer_reviews.author: adria

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solidly built and opened up a number of exercises where grip was limiting me. Eg you really can't cross grip on sumo squat. These more than compensate. I also appreciate not being tied to the bar, like most other straps. They do dog into the wrists just a little, but no more than expected, and the Velcro edges can be rough against the legs during deadlifts if you're not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: This is the grip you've been looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I've been involved in strength and power training just short of 30 years. The Cobra Grips are one of the all time best strength training investments I have ever made. Whether I am doing pause deadlifts, heavy weighted pull ups, or just need a little extra grip the Cobra Grips make it happen . They are well constructed, combination heavy nylon and leather, with solid stitches. They are built to take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P. Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for several months now. They are very sturdy and easy to use. Much faster than straps and not as uncomfortable in my opinion as hooks.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spear

customer_reviews.title: Practical for most pull movements
customer_reviews.text: These are good for back days or any pull movements. However, I find them not so practical for HEAVY barbell rows or rack pulls. For those specific workouts, I’d stick with my straps. I think these are great for going heavy on things like lat pulldowns, cable rows, dumbbell rows, ie. I used to use straps for those movements, but it can get really hectic to use for every single set. Cobra grips are really helpful for these workouts specifically.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Versa Grips for years. Now trying these I have been missing out. The quality of the Cobra Grips is unsurpassed. They have a very thick, wide and comfortable wrist band which is far more comfortable than the competition especially with loading up the pounds. The leather in the palm is of the highest quality with great feel unlike Versa which uses plasticy feeling material which gets slick with sweaty hands. Hands down the very best.
customer_reviews.author: KFrog

customer_reviews.title: getting me to the next level
customer_reviews.text: been lifting heavy for a while but feeling like i’ve plateaued... these gloves however have given me much more grip and strength in my wrists to go heavier. i’m liking it so far and would recommend to those who would like to lift heavier. also saves my palms from tearing up as i’m my medical profession requires me to work with others hands on.
customer_reviews.author: Chau Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: They’re AWESOME 😍😍💪🏾💪🏾
customer_reviews.text: I received my package on time, and was able to use for my next session which was back. I can definitely recommend these I ordered these obviously because I need more grip when it came to lifting much heavier especially with rack pulls and deadlifts. I have great grip strength but my hands tend to get sweaty a lot and when doing rack pulls or deadlifts I wasn’t able to rep out 315 with losing grip BUT once I got these OMFG just amazing absolutely amazin I recommend these for anyone that needs a little more assistance with grip when it comes to those heavy pull movements totally worth the money!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, all the materials are high quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product, all the materials are high quality. I was concerned about the durability of the straps before it showed up, but afyer using a few times im confident they will last. Sooo much faster than my traditional wrist wraps. I use them for deadlifts and dumbbell shoulder shrugs.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the wrists.
customer_reviews.text: Work like they should. Best thing is the better support on the wrists compared to traditional straps. Over time the normal straps can hurt your wrists if enough weight is used because they can get very tight. I began to notice this so gave them up for these. Pain went away thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and very well made.
customer_reviews.text: The best glove I have ever used for very heavy lifting. Especially deadlifts. My hat off to whoever came up with this invention. The most comfortable heavy lifting I have ever done without my past hand injuries limiting how heavy I can lift. I highly recommend this gloves to anyone that lifts weight out there.
customer_reviews.author: Pelesio Kama

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try
customer_reviews.text: One of those things you don't necessarily need when it comes to powerlifting and bodybuilding but a good welcome alternative to a combination of wrist wraps with a strap around it use it for a lot of my lat pulldown seated cable pulls and other aspects of lifting I want to reserve my already thick meaty calluses for
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Can lift more weight now that my wrists are supported
customer_reviews.text: These work great when lifting. Took some time getting used to what way to position them for specific lifts. Once I got that figured out they worked better. Had multiple wrist surgeries in the past. On the right hand wrap the stitching digs into the scar area. Had to change hands with the grips but it did solve the problem. Only real complaint I have it that wish the wrist wrap was a bit bigger to support the entire wrist without a gap. Have the rubber grips, will try the leather next time.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis T. Bunton III

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this product gets such high marks. The pair I received were terribly uncomfortable and the stitching on the rubber strap was poorly done. Sharp stitches were digging into my hands. Got rid of these without even bothering to lift in them a single time.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Gives a stable and solid grip
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Neoprene folds a little when tightening Pros: Solid construction, increased grip on heavy weights I'm new to lifting and I've recently started lifting heavier weights (for me). I've been working on building my grip strength, but I like using these in the meantime. They've been great for dumbbell rows and deadlifts. They're very easy to use and add confidence to move more weight.
customer_reviews.author: The World's Worst Rapper // Magician // Tech Vlogger // Gamer

product_meta.title: Cobra Grips PRO Weight Lifting Gloves Heavy Duty Straps Alternative Power Lifting Hooks Best for Deadlifts Adjustable Neoprene Padded Wrist Wraps Support Bodybuilding
feature_bullets: (REGISTERED PATENT No. # 2750562, USD752695S1 ) THE ONLY GEAR YOU NEED IN YOUR GYM BAG Replaces a grip pad, your lifting grips & power hooks
One SIZE Fits All With Adjustable Wrist Straps. Say Good BYE To WRIST WRAPS Our lifting grips have a built-in wrist support wrap for enhanced comfort
NO MORE SLIPS, NO MORE CHAFFING Provides ample padding to protect the palms & gives a tight grip

Our Cobra Grips PRO model fits wrist size from 5.5” up to 8.75” Most Men will find the PRO version to have a comfortable fit. Our Cobra Grips FIT Model fits wrist size from 4.25” up to 7.0” Many Women find the FIT version most comfortable. A TRULY COMFORTABLE FIT Fully adjustable 6mm neoprene gym glove alternative won't hold you back
PATENTED Ergonomically engineered with safety in mind; Maximum protection for the wrist TRADEMARK Reg. No. 5,025,077

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
